title: Client Beta Update #3: Closer to Completion

replies.body: When will you bring item sets to the updated client? I got information way back in patch 7.0 that item sets will be released in the updated client in around patch 7.1 or 7.2.. but i havn't seemed to find it happen just yet... have i missed them somewhere or is item sets still a thing to be released later on
This guy ask the right question, where is our item sets in new client?

Item sets are on the to-do list, but the focus right now is on getting the updated client released fully.  There's a bit more info & context around item sets in the Ask Riot post here - http://nexus.leagueoflegends.com/2017/03/ask-riot-movie-voice-item-sets/

Cheers!
Mindstar

While i can see your reasoning, personally I think your priorities are muddled there.

We have survived on both clients for months now with little issue.
There is no drastic need to update immediately.

Removing one client without compensating for features on the other however, WILL cause problems for players, and above all create animosity for the new client.

What possible harm could come from adding Item sets into the new client before retiring the old one?

Items sets surely aren't rocket science for the coding team. Even just an alpha-stage option that can be updated at your leisure, would be more than enough for most players at this point.

I was in the new client Alpha (and have used it ever since), and once you're used to it, its clear how much better it is from the old one. But forcing people into it BEFORE making sure that features people rely on have moved over as well, is a mistake.

Hold up, if you are moving to phase two, where Oceanic players will not be able to use legacy client (to create item sets) where does that leave me trying new characters? especially if you "run into a bug" where i'll indefinitely not be able to try new things...

What's the point of releasing the client fully when you havent fully finished the client yet. Not being able to create item sets is a pretty annoying thing to just be forced onto. It's like saying "we just created this new game but we hevent finished it yet, but here lets just release it anyways". A Beta is made so that people can try the new client and find any bugs with it, that you guys need to fix before releasing the client to everyone. otherwise there was not much point to even having a beta version.

Hi
We've just put out a slightly more detailed FAQ this morning which might answer this better than me... but...

For item sets - we actually were originally planning not to port them over at all (not that many players use the feature).  Thanks to a lot of feedback, we have changed that plan an will bring them back, once LCU is launched.  In the interim there *are* ways to manage them using the API and third-party sites.  So you won't be totally in the dark.

A note about Beta - you're exactly right it has been made available for players to test, find bugs and give feedback.  We're now confident that it is ready for prime-time and that the benefits to players will certainly outweigh the drawbacks.  

New features for League (e.g practice tool) will require the updated client, and the longer we keep the legacy client alive for, the slower this development will be.

This isn't exactly related to the new client per-say, but synchronous chat in champ select would reduce a lot of flame in normals! If the player's own chat was treated the same way as the chat for all other players (i.e. it doesn't appear in the client until it's reached the server and bounced back) calls would be much less ambiguous. Currently, a player can call first on their screen but no one else's, which can lead to a bad game for everyone.
